com.neosensory.tlepredictionengine

Class TlePredictionEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neosensory.tlepredictionengine.TlePredictionEngine

  • public class TlePredictionEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods useful for obtaining latitude/longitude/altitude coordinates for a given satellite based on its two line element (TLE) set and time

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TlePredictionEngine()

    • Method Detail

      • getSatellitePosition

        public static double[] getSatellitePosition(java.lang.String tleLine1,
                                            java.lang.String tleLine2,
                                            java.lang.Boolean useGeodetic)
        Get the current position of a satellite based on TLE at the time the method is called.
        Parameters:
        tleLine1 - String of te first TLE line
        tleLine2 - String of the second TLE line
        useGeodetic - boolean. If true, return coordinates in geodetic latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees), and altitude (km). If false, the method will return the TEME coordinates (x,y,z) in km.
        Returns:
        coordinates of the satellite at the current time in either geodetic or TEME

      • getSatellitePosition

        public static double[] getSatellitePosition(java.lang.String tleLine1,
                                            java.lang.String tleLine2,
                                            java.lang.Boolean useGeodetic,
                                            java.util.Date date)
        Get the position of a satellite based on TLE at the time specified
        Parameters:
        tleLine1 - String of te first TLE line
        tleLine2 - String of the second TLE line
        useGeodetic - boolean. If true, return coordinates in geodetic latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees), and altitude (km). If false, the method will return the TEME coordinates (x,y,z) in km.
        date - Date for getting the satellite position at a given point in time.
        Returns:
        coordinates of the satellite at the given point in time in either geodetic or TEME
